headline: Making Climate An All-American Issue

short descr: Congress must move collectively in guaranteeing longterm protection of our environment.

headline: Making Climate An All-American Issue
authors: William S. Becker, ContributorEnergy & Climate Policy Expert
short descr: Congress must move collectively in guaranteeing longterm protection of our environment.
image_caption(s): A study published in the journal Science estimates that Southern states in the U.S. will bear the worst costs. The damages will be nationwide, however, costing 1.2 percent of GDP for every degree of warming. This map shows the estimated costs of climate change as a percent of GDP in each U.S. county.

headline: Making Climate An All-American Issue
authors: William S. Becker, ContributorEnergy & Climate Policy Expert
short descr: Congress must move collectively in guaranteeing longterm protection of our environment.
image_caption(s): The high temperatures expected as a result of global climate change will negatively affect farm yields and heat-related deaths, already the No. 1 weather-related killer in the United States. The study published in Science estimates that every county between El Paso, Texas, and Charlotte, North Carolina, could see its mortality rate rise to nearly twice the deaths from automobile accidents.

headline: ‘The Voice’ Is Great TV. It’s Just Not Always Great For The Winners.
short descr: A handful of former contestants, plus host and producer Carson Daly, break down what happens after each season wraps.
image_caption(s): "Voice" winners Danielle Bradbery (season four), left, Sawyer Fredericks (season eight), Tessanne Chin (season five), Cassadee Pope (season three), Jordan Smith (season nine) and Chris Blue (season 12).

headline: ‘The Voice’ Is Great TV. It’s Just Not Always Great For The Winners.
short descr: A handful of former contestants, plus host and producer Carson Daly, break down what happens after each season wraps.
image_caption(s): Each coach has the choice to swivel around and try to convince the singer onstage to join their “team” of 12 contestants. If more than one coach turns, the contestant can choose which celebrity will guide them. Then battle rounds begin, when two teammates perform a duet that determines which half of the duo stays and which half goes. (If a performer is booted by their coach, another can "steal" that contestant.) The surviving singers perform in a knockout round before the final live shows.

headline: ‘The Voice’ Is Great TV. It’s Just Not Always Great For The Winners.
short descr: A handful of former contestants, plus host and producer Carson Daly, break down what happens after each season wraps.
image_caption(s): Billboard's Hot 100 highlights the most popular current songs across all genres, ranked by Nielsen data. Most of the winners' songs that charted were either "Voice" performances or original victory songs. Javier Colon’s coronation tune, “Stitch By Stitch,” landed at No. 17 in 2011, ahead of Craig Wayne Boyd’s “My Baby’s Got a Smile on Her Face” at No. 34 and Sawyer Fredericks’ “Please” at No. 37, both in 2015. Jordan Smith’s highest-performing song was his rendition of Queen’s “Somebody to Love,” which he performed on the show in December 2015.
